description:
Google’s Technical Infrastructure (TI) organization builds, operates, and maintains the infrastructure that makes Google possible. This covers everything from data centers and global networks to the hardware and software running on them.

At the core of TI is the Global Capacity Delivery (GCD) organization that delivers the compute capability that powers Google and the Google Cloud Platform. GCD leads the sourcing, manufacturing, distribution, and delivery of many other systems and components, from TPU (Tensor Processing Unit) ASICs to switches to racks and more.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • MBA or Master's degree in Engineering, Business or equivalent practical experience.
  • 15 years of experience managing supply chain and/or engineering teams.
  • Experience leading aspects of sourcing and supplier management.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in setting up, running, and optimizing a global, outsourced manufacturing supply chain.
  • Proven track record of success within large and complex enterprises with extensive hardware portfolio.
  • Ability to lead large teams and major programs, with strong understanding of P&L/operations expense "cause and effect" financials.
  • Ability to set direction, innovate, and motivate teams with ability to deal with ambiguity.
  • Ability to establish relationships at all levels of internal and external contacts.
responsibilities:
• Set and attain cost targets and assure supplier ramp readiness (capacity, factory, compliance, material management, etc.) to meet time-to-market launch.
  • Enable strategies to assure continuity-of-supply, timely resolution of supply escalations and shortages, and active mitigation of excess and obsolescence (E&O).
  • Partner with engineering to assure technology adoption across thet supply base. Manage supplier performance (cost, delivery, quality, tech) and drive for on-time agreement completion.
  • Lead vision, strategy, and set direction for the Global Commodity Management (GCM) function. Define strategies to achieve GCD’s goals and objectives within the component supply space.
  • Identify large and complex processes, tools, and/or structural gaps and define solutions.
title: Vice President, Global Supplier Management
